name: es/icon-point.mjs
IconPoint
description:
The IconPoint class
A point that exists inside/outside a virtual rectangle. The point's position inside/outside of the rectangle is maintained when the rectangle is rotated.
examples:
<caption>Example usage of this class</caption>
// Create a rectangle at the position of (0,0)
const rectangle = { x: 0, y: 0 };
// Make the dimensions of the rectangle 100x50
const bounds = { width: 100, height: 50 };
// Create a point at the top left corner of the rectangle
const point = { x: 1, y: 1, useRawPixels: true };
// Create an icon point that will track the point on this rectangle when it moves/rotates
const tlPoint = new IconPoint(rectangle, bounds, point);

name: defaultOffset
description: Static offset to use when none is passed.

name: defaultAnchor
description: Static anchor to use when none is passed. Default value of 0.5 signifies the anchor stars in the middle.

name: logger
description: The logger module this module uses to log errors / logs

name: rawPixelsPoint
description: An object storing the raw pixel position

unknown.tagValue: {number} x - The raw x pixel position of this point
{number} y - The raw y pixel position of this point

name: positionalPoint
description: An object storing the position of the rectangle

unknown.tagValue: {number} x - The x position of the rectangle
{number} y - The y position of the rectangle

name: point
description: An object storing the point's position with rotation taken into account.

unknown.tagValue: {number} x - The x position of the rectangle
{number} y - The y position of the rectangle

name: bounds
description: An object storing the rectangle's size.

unknown.tagValue: {number} width - The width of the rectangle
{number} height - The height of the rectangle
{number} pPoint.x - The x coordinate of the rectangle
{number} pPoint.y - The y coordinate of the rectangle
{number} pBounds.width - The width of the rectangle
{number} pBounds.height - The height of the rectangle
{number} pIconPoint.x - The x coordinate of the point inside/outside the rectangle
{number} pIconPoint.y - The y coordinate of the point inside/outside the rectangle
{boolean} [pIconPoint.useRawPixels=false] - Whether or not this point is defined in raw pixels or in a normalized 0-1 range

params.name: pPoint
params.description: The rectangle this icon point exists inside/outside of

params.name: pIconPoint
params.description: The point that exists inside/outside the rectangle. This is in relative positioning to the rectangle

name: getPoint
description: Gets the new point's position inside a rectangle after taking pAngle into account
examples:
<caption>Example usage of this method</caption>
// Create a rectangle at the position of (0,0)
const rectangle = { x: 0, y: 0 };
// Make the dimensions of the rectangle 100x50
const bounds = { width: 100, height: 50 };
// Create a point at the top left corner of the rectangle
const point = { x: 1, y: 1, useRawPixels: true };
// Create an icon point that will track the point on this rectangle when it moves/rotates
const tlPoint = new IconPoint(rectangle, bounds, point);

// Verify the point is where it should be
console.log(tlPoint.getPoint()) // { x: 0, y: 0 } This shows that the point is at the position (0,0) which is the top left position of the rectangle

// Changing the position of the rectangle
rectangle.x += 100;
// Verify the point is where it should be after the rectangle changes positions
console.log(tlPoint.getPoint()) // { x: 100, y: 0 } This shows that the point has moved to the updated position of the rectangle

// Applying some offsets to the rectangle
const rectangleOffsets = { x: 25, y: 25 };
// Verify the point is where it should be after offsets have been applied to the rectangle
console.log(tlPoint.getPoint(undefined, rectangleOffsets)) // { x: 125, y: 25 } This shows that the point has moved to the updated position based on the offsets of the rectangle

// Applying some rotation to the rectangle
const angle = Math.PI;
// Verify the point is where it should be after rotating the rectangle by `angle`
console.log(tlPoint.getPoint(angle)) // {x: 200, y: 50.00000000000001} This shows that the point has moved to the updated position after the rectangle had been rotated by `angle`.

unknown.tagValue: {number} pOffset.x - The x offset of the rectangle
{number} pOffset.y - The y offset of the rectangle
{object} The point inside/outside of the rectangle after rotating.

params.name: pAngle
params.description: Rotation of the rectangle this point exists inside/outside of in radians

return.description: The point inside/outside of the rectangle after rotating.

name: setPoint
description: Sets the static point and defines the raw pixels value

unknown.tagValue: {number} pPoint.x - The x coordinate of the point inside/outside the rectangle
{number} pPoint.y - The y coordinate of the point inside/outside the rectangle

params.name: pPoint
params.description: The point that exists inside/outside the rectangle
